New Records: Mitchell Santner became the first New Zealand spinner to register a five-for in Men's Cricket World Cup history
Key Match Events: Mitchell Santner took 5 wickets for 59 runs
Roelof van der Merwe's mix-up with Teja Nidamanuru ended with Nidamanuru being dismissed for 21
Colin Ackermann messed up a switch hit and gifted a catch to the Short Third
Ryan Klein was dismissed lbw to Mitchell Santner
Teja Nidamanuru was dismissed lbw to Mitchell Santner
Roelof van der Merwe took a brilliant catch running back off the bowling of Aryan Dutt to dismiss Mark Chapman
Scott Edwards fell trying to slog
Miscellaneous Highlights: Colin Ackermann was their highest-scorer with 69
Scott Edwards and Sybrand Engelbrecht were the other notable contributors for Netherlands
Will Young was the team's top-scorer with 70 for New Zealand
Rachin Ravindra scored a half-century for New Zealand
A smooth 70 off 80 from Will Young helped New Zealand consolidate their position
New Zealand's opening pair refused to get bogged down and opened their arms with a flurry of strokes
Netherlands' fielder Roelof van der Merwe took a brilliant catch running back off the bowling of Aryan Dutt to dismiss Mark Chapman
Others: New Zealand opened their arms with a flurry of strokes
New Zealand lost a few batters in the process of reaching 322/7
Netherlands made two changes into their XI
Klein and Sybrand Engelbrecht made it into the playing XI
Logan van Beek was out due to a hamstring strain
Bas De Leede is out to make his own mark on the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup while following in the footsteps of his father Tim De Leede
New Zealand were boosted by the return of Lockie Ferguson in place of James Neesham
Kane Williamson and Tim Southee weren't available for selection today
